questions.question_text:
While entering an expense report for your corporate card transactions, you notice that the conversion rate defined in the Manage Conversion Rates and Policies page is not used.
What is the reason?

discussion.content: Conversion rate behavior applies only to cash expenses, not to corporate card expenses.

choices.B: Only cash transactions use those settings.
choices.D: You did not specify a default expense template.
choices.A: You did not define conversion rates in the General Ledger Cloud.
choices.C: You did not define conversion rates for your business unit.

choices.B: The status of each payment in the payment file is Cancelled and the related documents are available for future selection.
choices.A: The invoices are placed on payment hold.
choices.C: The status of the payment file is Cancelled.
choices.E: The status of each payment in the payment file is Terminated.
choices.D: The status of the payment file is Terminated.

discussion.content:
B & D
The Options B & D are correct.

B & D
The Options B & D are correct.

questions.question_text:
A Payment Process Request was submitted and errors were found in the payment file. The payment file and process were terminated.
Which two statements are true?

discussion.content:
"Transferred information to Payables" That means "Process Expense Reimbursement program" has been submitted/completed which would have done all of the below (per https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/financials/18b/fawde/expense-reimbursements.html#FAWDE202958) 

Expense auditors run the Process Expense Reimbursement program to process expense reports and to create payment requests in Payables. All expense reports, for which payment requests are created, are updated with a payment request identifier. After payment requests are created, they remain in a Never Validated status until the invoice validation process is run in Payables. 

So the next step will be to "Validate the Invoice in Payables"
C. Validate the invoice in Payables.

choices.A: Transfer the data to General Ledger.
choices.B: Create Accounting for the invoice in Payables.
choices.D: Create a payment process request in Payments.

questions.question_text: You have successfully processed the expense reports for reimbursement and have transferred the information to Payables. What is the next step before you can pay them?

choices.E: Customers ask suppliers to send electronic invoices.
choices.B: Customers cannot use invoice imaging in the Cloud.
choices.D: Customers ask their suppliers to scan and email the invoice.
choices.C: Customers scan and store the invoice images on-premise and attach them during invoice entry.
choices.A: Customers scan the invoice on-premise and email the images.

questions.question_text: Identify two ways the invoice imaging solution works in the Cloud.

choices.D: On Mar 31st, Debit Rental Expense for 4,000 and Credit Prepaid Expense for 4,000
choices.B: On Jan 10th, Debit Prepaid Expense 12,000 and Credit Liability for 12,000
choices.C: On Jan 31st, Debit Rental Expense for 4,000 and Credit Prepaid Expense for 4,000 On Feb 28st, Debit Rental Expense for 4,000 and Credit Prepaid Expense for 4,000
choices.A: On Jan 10th, Debit Prepaid Expense 12,000 and Credit Liability for 12,000 and then On Jan 31st, Debit Rental Expense for 4,000 and Credit Prepaid Expense for 4,000 On Feb 28st, Debit Rental Expense for 4,000 and Credit Prepaid Expense for 4,000 On Mar 31st, Debit Rental Expense for 4,000 and Credit Prepaid Expense for 4,000

questions.question_text:
You are using the Payables Deferred Expense feature (also known as Multiperiod Accounting). You have entered an invoice for a three-month lease that is entered on Jan 10th. The total expense is $12,000 and it covers the rental period from Jan 1st to mar 31st.
Assuming that the rental expenses are split evenly per month and a monthly accounting calendar is used, what would the accounting entry be?
